Class ViewData

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.view.ViewData
public final class ViewData extends Object
This class represents all visual data required by the GUI to render the current game state. This includes the active brick shape and position, the next brick, the held brick, and the ghost piece's projected position.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors

    Creates a new ViewData object containing all visual information required by the GUI to render the current game state.

  • Constructor Details

    • ViewData

      public ViewData(int[][] brickData, int xPosition, int yPosition, int[][] nextBrickData, int[][] holdBrickData, Point ghostPieceOffset)
      Creates a new ViewData object containing all visual information required by the GUI to render the current game state. This includes the active brick, its position, the next brick, the held brick, and the ghost piece projection.
      Parameters:
      brickData - the shape data of the currently active brick
      xPosition - the x-coordinate of the active brick on the game grid
      yPosition - the y-coordinate of the active brick on the game grid
      nextBrickData - the shape data of the upcoming next brick
      holdBrickData - the shape data of the currently held brick, if any
      ghostPieceOffset - the projected (x, y) offset where the ghost piece should appear

  • Method Details

    • getHoldBrickData

      public int[][] getHoldBrickData()
      Returns a copy of the hold brick's data.
      Returns:
      a copy of the hold brick's data if true and null if false

    • refreshHoldBrickData

      public void refreshHoldBrickData()
      Updates the hold brick data.

      If there is no currently held brick, the active brick is stored and replaced with the next brick. Otherwise, the active brick is swapped with the held brick.
